title: Apple once Again Takes Top Spot for the World’s Best-Selling Smartphone
description: Trailing behind it are the iPhone 15 Pro Max and iPhone 15 Pro. The post Apple once Again Takes Top Spot for the World’s Best-Selling Smartphone appeared first on Phandroid.
author: Mike Viray
excerpt: Trailing behind it are the iPhone 15 Pro Max and iPhone 15 Pro.
text: As much as we here on Phandroid love our Android devices, there’s little doubt that Apple’s worldwide popularity has remained consistent over the years, and although it might occasionally lose to Samsung (its closest competitor), it does manage to climb back up time and time again. READ: How to use Apple AirPods Pro 2 as hearing aids At least that’s what the numbers show – recent data from research firm Counterpoint Research indicates that the iPhone 15 currently sits as the world’s best-selling smartphone for Q3 2024, even outselling the newer iPhone 16. Trailing behind it are the iPhone 15 Pro Max and iPhone 15 Pro, followed by a number of budget Android phones from Samsung. Surprisingly, the Samsung Galaxy S24 managed to sneak into 10th place, trailing just behind the Redmi 10C. This makes it the first S-series model in a while to climb into the Q3 top ten – the last time this happened was back in 2018. The iPhone 15 was launched last year, and while Apple has promised several years of software support for the device it does lack some features found on the newer iPhone 16 models, such as the camera control button, as well as support for Apple intelligence. Source: Counterpoint Research
html:
As much as we here on Phandroid love our Android devices, there’s little doubt that Apple’s worldwide popularity has remained consistent over the years, and although it might occasionally lose to Samsung (its closest competitor), it does manage to climb back up time and time again.

READ: How to use Apple AirPods Pro 2 as hearing aids

At least that’s what the numbers show – recent data from research firm Counterpoint Research indicates that the iPhone 15 currently sits as the world’s best-selling smartphone for Q3 2024, even outselling the newer iPhone 16. Trailing behind it are the iPhone 15 Pro Max and iPhone 15 Pro, followed by a number of budget Android phones from Samsung.

Surprisingly, the Samsung Galaxy S24 managed to sneak into 10th place, trailing just behind the Redmi 10C. This makes it the first S-series model in a while to climb into the Q3 top ten – the last time this happened was back in 2018.

The iPhone 15 was launched last year, and while Apple has promised several years of software support for the device it does lack some features found on the newer iPhone 16 models, such as the camera control button, as well as support for Apple intelligence.

Source: Counterpoint Research
